website_summaries.verdict: The lightest and smallest Surface ever made is the perfect option for traveling, and with its gorgeous display and long battery life, you’ll wonder how you hit the road without one.
pros: Up to 9 hours of battery life
cons: Unlike most Surface tablets, the Surface Go is only available in a single color: platinum

customer_reviews.title: Strictly a secondary computer...love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great portable computer. I have the Surface Pro 3 so I am familiar with the Surface family. I decided to see how long I can use the Surface Go with windows 10 S OS, which means that you can only install apps from the MS Windows Store...so far, so good. If I have a need to upgrade to Windows 10 Home, the switch is very easy via the Windows Store...just remember, you may have to update the Windows Store app then the upgrade to Windows 10 Home, for free, is available. I use this as a secondary computer to surf web, watch Netflix, work on MS Office documents...works exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Bexter

customer_reviews.title: The Worst Purchase I've Ever Made. EVER.
customer_reviews.text: Let me count the things that don't work.... I can't download PDF files from my Gmail account, so much of my email is useless. When I try to login to Steam, no typing interface pops up, so I can't login and access my games. I can't download a Kindle reader, so I can't access my books. I can't access Amazon Prime streaming video, so I can't access videos! NOTHING WORKS!!! In sum, I spent $540 (including tax) on this piece of garbage, and nothing -- absolutely nothing -- I planned to use it for works. Maybe one day Microsoft will work out the kinks. For now, stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What you see in NOT what you get!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed!...It turns out the keyboard, pen and mouse displayed in most of the product photos do NOT ship with the device. It's a pretty shameless bait-n-switch gambit, if you ask me. You need to look very VERY closely at the near microscopic notice near the bottom of some photos to notice this rather important fact. I find no mention of it in the product description text. I will be returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Just some guy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware: Warranty does not start from purchase date!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the product itself, but be aware the warranty does not start from the date you purchase, but the date the distribution purchased it. I just purchased this and the warranty on the device shows it ends in less than 6 months(It says it comes with one year). Also, due to the fact that the warranty is 6 months in already I cannot add Microsoft Complete. Save yourself some time and order through Microsoft itself. I’m guessing this is because Amazon is not an authorized selling agent of Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: are you kidding me ?
customer_reviews.text: you can only use verified apps on this surface, no chrome, no google drive, no other 3rd party apps, I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Family

customer_reviews.title: Surface Go, Go Go!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a hybrid computer to use for my personal life. I have a designated work computer for my business. I wanted something I could take with me everywhere and use for reading, movies, shopping, videos, etc... I have used it to stream music, Netflix, shop and write reviews on Amazon. :-) This computer has fit all my criteria and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Coppinger

customer_reviews.title: Defective right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product with high hopes of replacing my very old laptop. When receiving the item it was defective right out of the box. Within 5-10 minutes of using it the screen went black. Every time I tried using it the screen kept going black. I tried looking of issues online but after a couple days decided to call Microsoft support. They couldn't figure it out so they told me to return it to them. A very disappointing product. Waiting to hear back from Microsoft as to what they are going to do.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Elrick

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Fails Again.
customer_reviews.text: Was happy to receive this product in just 2 days but as usual with a Microsoft product, could not it set up. Set up would not accept my birthdate even though I tried many times. Don’t know why Microsoft requires a person to open an account requiring all kinds of personal information before you can even use the product. I refuse to spend hours on the phone with Microsoft trying to resolve. I’m returning this product tomorrow when the UPS Store opens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I will never buy Microsoft product again
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Surface Go in Sept 2018 it is Jan 2019 and it will not turn on - charged the battery and after will not turn on. Tried to contact support (one year warranty for hardware malfunctions) and all I can get is their phone system and no person unless I sign up for their charged technical support Frustrated, Frustrated.....
customer_reviews.author: iMac user

customer_reviews.title: Great if you need something on the go
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the surface, except a couple things. The surface is great. However I do not understand why it does not come standard with the keyboard ($100 separate purchase which is quite expensive for a keyboard). Personally I only use it with the keyboard and when I occasional use it without it feels out of its element. Not to mention its heavily marketed with the surface. However I imagine people who use a pen and draw and write on the surface would not have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surface Go - Just what the doctor ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Go right away after it was released with the anticipation that I could replace older desktops with a tablet solution. I was right. Pair the 8GB Go with Windows 10 Pro then connect it to a Plugable USBC-3 Thunderbolt enabled hub and you have the perfect desktop replacement. Way to go Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Good 2-in-1
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this would make a good tablet as the apps available are limited compared to iOS and Android devices, but it does make a great little computer for a kid or someone who does a lot of traveling and doesn't want a bulky laptop weighing them down.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Kenworthy

customer_reviews.title: Sufarce go review
customer_reviews.text: This product is not that great as it sounds. The picture quality is very mediocre and I feel ipads have much better screens. The product itself is a bit slow, it’s alright but it’s not great. The product comes with windows s mode which can be later updated to 10 for free. The keyboard you need to buy separate. Maybe it’s better of a choice to go for a different product like the yoga from toshiba. This is just over rated and does not deliver the punch it should
customer_reviews.author: Thejitha

customer_reviews.title: 500 dollar paperwieght
customer_reviews.text: I tried one at the Microsoft store really impressed. But the unit I got sent is unbelievably slow and buggy. From a very dim screen. Keyboard not working. Constantly locking up and needing reset. Touch Input on screen not working. Wifi not working. Many more problems I just purchased this. And I don't know if it's just my unit but I am stuck with this. No warranty. No support. No help. So now I have to go buy something else that will preform the function I purchased this to do. But it is unable
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Sort of blah to me
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today......and honestly im not impressed. I feel like I could have a gotten a little more bang for my buck. Ive spent less on better...my asus chromebook flip is better than this honestly. I don't see all the hype, thinking about sending it back but ill give it a little more time play with it a little more. Nothing special about the specs...it moves a bit slow...its cute but that's about it. Honestly wish I would have waited and really weighed out my options. Will update my review with a little more play...but so far its just blah.
customer_reviews.author: NurseNicole

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect for being on the go!
customer_reviews.text: I love Microsoft surface! I have a surface pro 3 that I have had since 2014 and I love it. I wanted something smaller, lightweight, and a bit more like a tablet and that’s exactly what the surface go did for me. I cannot tell you how pleased I am that Microsoft made the surface go! I can take it anywhere and carry it anywhere. In the picture I put it in a case already (which was obviously sold separately).
customer_reviews.author: JHarris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect secondary device
customer_reviews.text: The Surface Go is great as a secondary device that's easy to take around with you pretty much anywhere. It's perfectly sufficient for basic productivity on the go (with the typecover), for media consumption like youtube and Netflix, and for touchscreen specific tasks that a desktop or larger clamshell style laptop isn't suited for, like taking notes or (nonprofessional) artwork (with the pen). I personally use it for all of these things on a daily basis, and I've never been disappointed, even with the 4GB model. However, if you're looking to replace a more powerful machine (Surface Pro, laptop, or desktop) I don't think that this or even the 8GB model will be sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Allocca

customer_reviews.title: Heat Issue + update after 8 months (I was scammed. Do check this the day you receive your item)
customer_reviews.text: It heats up pretty quickly. On the small working of day to day tasks with standard web browsing, it heats up pretty quickly. So I bought this in Feb 2019, and it's Sept 2019. The Limited manufacturer warranty is for one year and should end in Feb 2020, but I was checking today, and the date they had for my surface go was 11/19/2019. So either they gave me a used surface go, or something is wrong. This is really heartbreaking when you send 500+ bucks on something only to find out you have been scammed.
customer_reviews.author: LSS

customer_reviews.title: Vestility is in comparison with Apple
customer_reviews.text: Very intrusive little tablet. Microsoft wants to access your information, share your email, can't register it to my school g mail, and can't connect it to my printer. As far as their versatility they must be taking notes from Apple. Should have just gotten a Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gatelg

customer_reviews.title: weak and incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Very slowly for simple tasks such as surfing the internet and writing text. The accessories are very expensive. It's expensive for what it offers.
customer_reviews.author: Flavio Brito

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for Microsoft portability
customer_reviews.text: I like the portability, and lightness of the tablet. I like having the microsoft product and auromatic access to my network. I don't like having to buy my office products that I already subscribe to. The battery life will not last 9 hours. You are not allowed to download or install aps from any sites but the Microsoft store.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Gipson

customer_reviews.title: Everything is Peachy BUT THE KEYBOARD
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard has ware and tare all over it. When you hit keys/ the touch pad it makes indents. Loved this purchase but wish Microsoft would make it up by replacing these! Work harder
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stuck in S mode...
customer_reviews.text: Fine machine but is in "S" mode which is not advertised. What is "S" mode. Microsoft will not allow YOU the OWNER of the machine, that YOU PURCHASED to download or use programs they don't like. For instance, I do not like IE as it has way too many political news articles. I like Firefox, I can have my OWN homepage, for my Own Computer. Also will not allow you to download Norton from your Norton account, just a basic app from store. Cannot switch out of "S" Mode, and that needs to be advised! Some may not care, but I would not have purchased if I knew! Should have been advertised. Returning!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do your research first.  This is a MS product designed for use with MS software
customer_reviews.text: Not easily compatible with chrome O/S but my bad for not researching more. Microsoft goes out of it's way to make it difficult to use non MS software and given the relatively steep price, this isn't acceptable to me, so i returned it and am happy with a Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for digital designers
customer_reviews.text: Would love to give this a better score. But this experience with the touch keyboard not always working, most praised pen being as good as a high class painting cool, and the brightness slidder not always working, really put me off with a buyers remorse, making me think I just bought myself another glorified laptop instead. This was not what I was expecting this to be.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Augustene

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little machine!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an IT professional, and I get to use a lot of snazzy tech. I have to say that this Surface Go strikes a terrific balance between utility and portability. The build quality is outstanding. You can tell a lot of little details were obsessed over by Microsoft. No, it's not a power-user dream machine. But for what most people would need it for (web, email, light games, MS Office tasks, etc.) this is a truly productive device that can easily be taken anywhere. I really don't have a single bad thing to say about it. It's just an example of wonderful blend of features and performance in a small package.
customer_reviews.author: macgyver35

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my mom and I have to admit, I want one for my self. You can install a full copy of windows 10, so can do almost anything you want, no restrictions and you can also just use it as a regular tablet. It's beautiful and very convenient to replace a laptop when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I had a Surface Pro 4 and loved it and needed to replace that, The Go is a bit smaller which makes it really nice for travel but it also works well at home. I have office onboard and everything works great. 8 MG ram onboard too. The only way I can get a second monitor connected is via my Surface pro desktop connector. The Go cannot connect to an external monitor so if a second monitor is a must then this may not be the best option. No USB connection either so my camera etc all require different approaches for file transfer. With these notes, I am still very happy with the Go.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Nice drawing tablet
customer_reviews.text: It’s a really good machine. But I recommend to buy the one with more memory. Cause sometimes it’s freezing... I dont like that. But the pen is really aweosome I use it to draw it and works great
customer_reviews.author: Belen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I felt like the information was very misleading because of the picture, I assumed the keyboard came with it but it did not. So I had to spend another 100 bucks between a keyboard, a mouse and a pen. I thought the screen was a little bit bigger to, kinda hard to get my school work done on. I think it's to much money for just the screen for sure. Also it's sent in s mode, therefore you can't download any app or anything unless its Microsoft. I need webex for school and zoom for school but it won't let me download or switch out of s mode. Complete waiste of money
customer_reviews.author: Chelsye bacon

customer_reviews.title: I use this almost exclusively.  Overclocked desktop, Surface Pro 4 are lonely.
customer_reviews.text: I browse all day, run some spreadsheets, play music with foobar 2000 and Peace EQ, run Malwarebytes paid version and Windows Defender. It's got a low-power CPU chip, but I can browse in Chrome with 15 tabs open, with no lags. I am running a Windows Defender full scan as I type this, and response is great. Since the Go is so small, the battery doesn't have as much capacity as larger units, but I got 5+ hours of constant browsing, with lots of tabs always open. I think that's fantastic. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad product.
customer_reviews.text: After the first day of use the tablet requested an update. It took four hours and when the update was finished the tablet was not working properly. There was a message that there were files missing. I try to reset the tablet to the factory settings and it was not possible. The missing files did not let me to do the factory reset.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Thaniotis

customer_reviews.title: Wow - come on micro-soft you can do better
customer_reviews.text: Screen lasted less than 2 weeks, with basic use and backpack storage - like all other tablets (chrome, apple). MS doesn't warranty - makes sense because they crack and want $250 to repair - 40% of the cost of the tablet to begin with. Stay away. Many other options to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Its a Solid 2 out of 5
customer_reviews.text: It's a great tablet if you don't expect much... It is slow, battery disappoints... I bought this primarily to use at college, I left an iPad Air2 for this tablet, and yeah... I regret not buying another iPad... If you are deciding between and New ipad or Surface GO, take my advice, I have both and iPads are WAYYYYY better then this...
customer_reviews.author: João Lima

customer_reviews.title: Best mini surface yet, but not without a compromise.
customer_reviews.text: The Surface Go is sleeker, somewhat smaller and lighter than my Surface 3. It is also much much faster. But it overheats easily once you try to utilize that processing power for some demanding programs. Still not a 100 percent there I think. The next design must a)use a revolutionary low tdp / high capability processor and/or b)have a fan inside.
customer_reviews.author: Kayhan Torpil

customer_reviews.title: Update: Defective unit
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware!!!! I received a counterfeit product. Windows 10 home is supposed to be a free upgrade. When I got to the upgrade section, the pop-up told me I had to buy it. So I went to the About settings and tried to install from there. Got a warning that Windows could not install. It had an invalid key. Update: After speaking to the seller the unit was found to be defective. For whatever reason the software refuses to acknowledge the Windows installation as being a Genuine Windows Product. It is a REAL Microsoft product - I just happened to buy a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: jonni27

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: After watching tons of online review videos on YouTube I was convince that this product was going to be a good buy. I got the 8gb RAM and 128gb SSD which was the recommendation of many of the reviews it made sense. After testing out the entry model at best buy it was clear to me that the more expensive model was the way to go. However, for kids/students the entry level should be enough.
customer_reviews.author: Blackmayza

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Buy Apple or Google.Piece of junk. Only used it a few times a month but still only lasted 6 months. Microsoft tells me they have on at the store 45 minutes from me. I drive there to swap it out to then be told oh we don't have it. No other option given even after telling him I was told you had one and I drove 45 minutes just to swap this out. Just a stupid look from the technician. So after waisting 2 hours I still have a broken Surface. Now on the black hole call with Microsoft no
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Better options available
customer_reviews.text: A nice little device but I can get a bigger iPad for less money and have WAY more functionality and app access (especially free educational apps for my granddaughter). I wanted to use this device for a digital planner and discovered the apps available for Android pale in comparison to those available for Apple ... and I have NEVER been an Apple user. I know Microsoft and computers but this was still not very intuitive to use and the Android apps seem clunky and lacking compared to apps for Apple.
customer_reviews.author: MzOnPointPromo

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: In less than a year the product got super slow and I had to do two resets! There is no way to do a factory reset without depending on other device or external media which does not come included with the device. What a waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tiago

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful every day pc!
customer_reviews.text: Was sceptical about the performance of this but decided to get it because I needed somthing small and compact. I got the 8ram and 128gb drive. I'm very impressed with the surface go! Touch screen is super responsive! Has very nice picture and it dosent feel sluggish at all. Very good everyday PC, obviously not for hard core gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Kakiraz

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet
customer_reviews.text: Only had the GO for a couple of days, but so far I am extremely pleased with my purchases. First thing I switched it out of S mode and it is running software like a champ! Very solid machine and great small platform. Comes in at just over 1lbs with the type cover and protective case. Strongly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Larry S

customer_reviews.title: Have use it to the fullest yet
customer_reviews.text: Am still trying to see how well the battery life is on a long working day. update i like it, but the battery does not last and the keyboard locked up in Microsoft office even though I have an office subscription. It is light and I wish I could keep it, but I needed it for school and work and if the battery cannot go more the 3 hours it makes no sense to keep it. I sent it back and bought a surface 3 hopefully it is better because i am tired of teasing in my ipads.
customer_reviews.author: The Cater Girl

customer_reviews.title: very light weight
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a light weight tablet that is easy to pack and this fits the bill. Very thin and easy to fit into tote bag, I like the titanium material, hopefully it will not get scratched up with much use. Very fast processor. Screen in smaller than I expected. So glad it has touch screen to enlarge print. Battery life is not as long as Surface RT so I keep the screen darker to extend battery when not plugged in. Not crazy about the calendar, I liked the RT calendar better. Over all, works well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Cute Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Tried this after having iPad stolen. Touch screen is not very good not even close to my previous iPad usually takes a few attempts to get a response from windows pad. Extremely slow compared to iPad loading apps and programs. Construction of hardware seems very cheap. Wanted to a product not made by Apple as it has been about 5 years since using non apple pads or phones. Now I know why Windows has a ways to go on their pads. Though I am a fan of USB port on surface. Maybe apple will loosen up a bit on their control and give iPads a USB port on iPads they would be unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Shon

customer_reviews.title: Warrant Information is a little off
customer_reviews.text: Amazing device, don't understimate the power of this tiny Pentium. When I received my item the warranty date was off, calling Microsoft they were able to adjust it for me
customer_reviews.author: lramos15

customer_reviews.title: Best lightweight college laptop, or just college laptop in general!
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is a bit limited (2-3 hours in my experience) but it's perfect for college students, and it was priced extremely affordably conpared to other laptops. Performance is about as average as expected for a laptop computer, but it makes up for it with its convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this little device! Many reviews focus on the processing power and such, but if you know exactly what you'll do with this tablet it doesn't really matter much! The build quality is superb, and for daily tasks it works like a charm. I use it now daily for many things including light music production, and the fact that is a little Windows machine in the body of a tablet makes doing anything on the go a real pleasure. Many folks seem rather confused by the "S mode" thing. KNOW THAT YOU CAN TAKE YOUR SURFACE GO OUT OF S MODE FOR FREE. This way you'll have access of everything windows! Couldn't be happier with the product!
customer_reviews.author: AUGUSTO U.

customer_reviews.title: Superior mobility
customer_reviews.text: This device is amazing. I chucked my boat anchor in favor of this device. If mobility is required, you camt go wrong with the go. I am in the low voltage field and when it comes to taking notes, making quick drawings or annotating docs, this device is invaluable. Using it for sales is a show stopper with the bright display and accessible UI. Aside from below average performance and disappointing battery (which can be overcome via settings or portable charger), think it's my 2nd favorite device.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: It's the best of many worlds
customer_reviews.text: The Surface Go is the best of many different electronic products. It is a tablet that is light, watchable, with great graphics. It is a small and light computer that is easy to fit in your knapsack or briefcase. If you are in a meeting of any kind and you take the GO from your bag, people will be all over you to see what it is and how simple to do anything you need it to. I would buy it again because although I have not used it for a long time, I have been thrilled by what it is capable of.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have with it, if you have the glass screen protector added to it, you can not use the Surface kit UBS C Hub. They kept telling me it would work, however you can NOT plug the surface kit in with the glass on the screen. I had them send me a second one and had the same problem, so I took the glass off and that resolved the issue with not being able to plug in the Surface kit. I love me Surface go. I just have to be careful since I do not have the extra protection glass on it.
customer_reviews.author: jeffreyjones

customer_reviews.title: Good power in a portable package
customer_reviews.text: I got this computer to replace my full-powered laptop, while at school and traveling. Despite how compact it is, I never feel like I'm working on a small screen (like with my cell phone). Although the keyboard and stylus are not included, you can find them both very cheap on amazon. It works seamlessly with both the keyboard and stylus, the battery life is as advertised, and it can handle any non-graphics-card-intensive programs that most budget laptops can handle. I wouldn't run more than two or three programs on it at once. If you do, it will slow down quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: A good bedside tablet
customer_reviews.text: This device is good for watching Youtube videos and reading pdf documents while you’re lying on the bed. It’s easier to carry around and use anywhere than a laptop, but don’t expect to do more other than web browsing and simple tying.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worth my money
customer_reviews.text: Since I am using the surface go for online school work, and drone photography editing I have to say it gets what I need done. My only complaint is the little storage it has, and the battery life. But that isnt really a big problem. I would reccomend this to anyone that wants a well compact laptop. I went from a mac book to this and I would say I like the surface go more. Just because it is travel friendly, and the many accessories it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Quillin

customer_reviews.title: Solid laptop/tablet for on the "go"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for school (for taking notes and whatnot) and for reading and it has served its purpose well. Paired with a pen it is useful for taking handwritten notes, paired with the keyboard its is good for typing notes, and the battery life isn't super shabby (6ish hours with mixed us, 10 hours for just reading or taking notes without using Chrome/Edge). Using edge DOES give better battery life though. I definitely recommend, but perhaps there is a v2 coming out soon.
customer_reviews.author: Sahil Gandhi

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built, but Microsoft doesn’t support apps typically found in app stores.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Surface Go so I could start moving away from using my aging laptop. What I found with this product is that Microsoft wants you to only use their programs and apps. You can’t download apps that I have found on Google Play and the Apple Store. While the Surface Go seems to be built well, I can’t seem to use it for what I had intended so I actually wasted a lot of money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No warranty
customer_reviews.text: Nice to find out months later that there is no warranty on this item. I wish I had gone to Best Buy. New review: Microsoft is working on the warranty issue. An Amazon assistant was on the telephone with me for over three (3) hours trying to assist me in getting this thing to work. Suppose to get the warranty resolved in two more days. It seems Microsoft has "procedures." Tablet still going off for no apparent reason.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Botkin

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet with palm rejection and pressure sensitivity capabilities.
customer_reviews.text: I've got two tablets for drawing. This is the one I end up going to. While there are more free software options for the Android, the full blown Windows 10 on this thing makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my daughter and she just loves it. She has been scarce since she got it because she is on it all the time. She watches movies, surfs, and is doing school work on it. No complaints at all. Got here quick too. I would have liked to see a little better packing.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L

customer_reviews.title: It's been 45 days and the computer has stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Suddenly today, the screen ceased to turn on. I'd had no problems with the screen prior. Very disappointing because I spent a long time deciding on the Surface Go and only bought it last month. Microsoft is sending a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Shanester

customer_reviews.title: Perfect secondary computer
customer_reviews.text: I love my surface go. Don't give me wrong, there are some cons like battery life, about 5 to 6 hours, and the processor performance is not that good, but as a secondary hybrid computer, is perfect, I love it and I enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Marroquin

customer_reviews.title: Met my need for the most part...
customer_reviews.text: I like the look, the size, the style...Paired with a detachable keyboard and dongle to transfer files from my flash drive, I can work from anywhere... The sound quality is really great for a machine this size. I disliked that it only has one port for the USB attachment. Otherwise I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui B

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: It's good to bring to school to take notes for girls. I have been using it for two years. However, if you want to do multiple tasks, it turns slow. Anyway, It's not heavy, that's what I want.
customer_reviews.author: spidershan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality/performance.
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about two weeks. I use it mainly for Word, PowerPoint, Excel and web browsing to do homework. Speakers sound good enough and the kickstand is amazing. I haven’t tried any gaming on it but that’s what gaming PCs are for. I have the 8GB RAM 128GB SSD model.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Solid Addition Surface Faaily
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little tablet is this Microsoft Surface Go. I bought he 8GB RAM 128G HD. Does an excellent job with all I need to do: email, miracast for work presentations, internet along with some light music listening and casual movie streaming. Keyboard is tiny bit small, but I got use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Williams

customer_reviews.title: Small, portable and fast enough
customer_reviews.text: It's fast enough for everything I need to do during my travel. I used it for importing, geotag and adjusting my photos with Capture One. Works fine. Not super fast but fast enough. Battery life is good. I really hope it have 2 usb c port so I don't need to bring extra adapter to charge my surface go.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not good experience at all
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking of returning. I received this today. The first application I installed from the Microsoft Store crashed when trying to open. I installed it minutes after turning it on. I tried to open OneNote and just get an error. The pop-up keyboard stuck and wouldn't close. I've heard good things about the surface but my experience has been horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Broke 3 months 1 day after buying
customer_reviews.text: Super frustrated .. great product, loved it but cannot turn on. Didn't purchase warranty because I would have swapped out after 12 months .. now left with no working device - super frustrated and disappointed - back to apple I guess.
customer_reviews.author: James Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Replace my notebook with pen
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Go and getting used to taking notes and replace my handwritten notebook. Love the size and easy to carry around. Just had to buy the surface pen.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic to work while on travel.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Surface Go to work on documents while traveling to Europe. I have other laptops but the Go is so portable for writing an Internet access while traveling, that is hard to beat. The screen is fantastic and the keyboard the same. Only wish it had a little better battery life. But with an extra battery pack plugged to the C-port problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: VPR

customer_reviews.title: Great product, with a bad battery
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, I run both Windows 10 and Ubuntu, and it works great. Be advised that I've never been able to get more than 4 hours on a full charge.
customer_reviews.author: Dissapointed Customer

customer_reviews.title: S/Safe Mode = Extremely Limiting
customer_reviews.text: S-mode means "safety mode", and that means you can't download other browsers or anything else that is not included in the Microsoft Store. There's not much in the Microsoft Store. After spending 3 hours trying various directions on how to disable S mode, I'm going to have to return this Surface Go - disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon N Doran

customer_reviews.title: Decent tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far I am happy with the purchase. Still on the S operating system so my software is constrained. Runs a bit slower than a regular computer I am used to using. But for a lower price tablet, that is a given. Better price here than Best Buy and Amazon. Don't forget the typing cover. Stylus is nice to have too.
customer_reviews.author: JS 369

customer_reviews.title: My new travel buddy!
customer_reviews.text: This little pc is powerful enough to take it on the road, yet very light. I can use peripheral devices, like a projector, when I am presenting to clients. If you are looking for good performance and light-weight, as long as you store your documents are saved in the cloud, you are good to go. I have Office 365 and the desktop applications works perfect on this device. Also good for Teams and Zoom desktop apps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I use it for browsing and to remote into work by docking it onto a larger screen, works great for both, make sure to pick up a USB C dongle to connect to an external monitor. This an also be charged via The USB C but I have not tested it yet. Buy used and save yourself some money :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: replaces my laptop
customer_reviews.text: The only faults I have found are scrolling on the screen is not as smooth as an ipad and, if you multiple external drives you can not move data between them (directly)
customer_reviews.author: Jared B.

customer_reviews.title: Portable and user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have no real complaints. I got this for homework when I am on the go. The small size makes it easily portable. The processing speeds do seems a bit slow, but not enough to cause irritation. There's so much this device can do, but my favorite is that I can keep a journal, with my own writing and drawings.
customer_reviews.author: Ebony H.

customer_reviews.title: My husbands new thin mistress
customer_reviews.text: My husbands new obsession. She's sleek, thin, sharp, you can dress her how you want, comes with fun new toys and most importantly... she has a mute button. She keeps him quite and happy so I guess you can call it a win/win. Told call it a tablet in his presence though. She's a computer! *eye roll*
customer_reviews.author: K.Sheets

customer_reviews.title: It fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it because it looked so beautiful. In addition, I was hoping it would fit my tablet. It is both beautiful and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Cataldi Alice

customer_reviews.title: Return and credit issue NOT acceptable
customer_reviews.text: Supplier received the product back on May 27th, no credit, nor conformation as of yet. $500.00 + payment in limbo!
customer_reviews.author: Val Artman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tablet computer. This is my second one. I love this setup. On the go or use at your desk. Has all you need. No disappointment here.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye O.

customer_reviews.title: Overall good, though we did experience a screen issue six months in.
customer_reviews.text: First one worked great for six months, then experienced a sudden issue with the screen. Apparently this issue is well known - we googled it - and is non fixable by owners. Screen had a bunch on lines drawn along it as if happy the horizontal pixels stopped working. The good news is that it was under warranty and MS was great about easily replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for My Boyfriend
customer_reviews.text: Made this purchase for my boyfriend for his job. He seems to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Ipad.
customer_reviews.text: Switched it allow regular apps to be installed, this little thing rocks.
customer_reviews.author: L.Laurents

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and the flexibility of having a tablet and PC combo. Although I tend to use this as a tablet, I find the PC experience to be pleasurable. I have purchased both the unit and the keyboard. Several reviewers have noted the slowness of the device, however, I have not found speed to be an issue. At the same time, I view this as more of a tablet than a laptop. Thus, my expectations in several categories are within the range of such a device.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Robert White

customer_reviews.title: Portable and surprisingly powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I use the Surface Go mostly as a pdf reader and laptop for schoolwork. It's a powerful little 2 in 1 that surprised me, given it's compact size, able to run some low impact games as well (Stardew Valley runs without any issue). The battery normally lasts around 4 or 5 hours when I'm using it for pdfs or Word processing, combined with web browsing. Overall I am really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase -- very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent to use on the go. Took it with me on vacation. Very lightweight and good battery life. Can even play Civ 6 without issues. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet/pc
customer_reviews.text: For those of you with bad vision, the small screen size can be a problem. Performs very well, and I love that USB-C port!
customer_reviews.author: Clawed

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet
customer_reviews.text: bought as replacement for older Surface Pro. All the features I liked in the past and great new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mari B. Gruber

customer_reviews.title: Went belly up during first day :(
customer_reviews.text: It was love at first set up amd then the touch screen stopped working and it's stuck forever. Sadness abounds!
customer_reviews.author: Mpls Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife to use with Kindle, she loves it! Longer battery life would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: T. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Great value and utility
customer_reviews.text: Only had it since Nov 27 so unable to rate battery or durability. Otherwise works really well, cna;t se how you could do better at the price.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet combo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Surface 3. I wanted to stay in the Surface family, but I did not need anything fancy. I only write papers and stream tv, so this 2 in 1 tablet computer was perfect for me. I feel that the battery could last a little bit longer, but no other complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Love the size, weight and performance. I mainly use for email, church reports both in Word, XL,PPT and totally serves my purpose. So easy to take with me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE!!!! Does not hold up to iPad
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a nice iPad alternative for basic streaming/power point/emails & general use. I have kept it in S mode as windows recommends but have found that within one year the PC is already incredibly slow. It won’t stream basic broadcast like live games on ESPN without buffering, glitching or requiring a complete restart of the PC. Have GB speed internet that is very quick so this purchase has been very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Love the surface!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little “laptop” / “ipad” type mix. Perfect for all my at home activities!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Portability can't get any better
customer_reviews.text: This is my best surface device. Portable, versatile and fulfills the purpose for which I got it. I've used the surface pro 3 and currently have the surface book. This might not beat those in terms of speed, but it does beat them in terms of portability. I couldn't wish for a better tablet and pc hybrid. Looking forward to see what the next generation of the surface Go would look like.
customer_reviews.author: Izzi

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love...
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was more of an offering in the surface app store. I'm used to Apple apps... so I'm missing some things... but the device is great for home and work use together where Apple was not.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Bell

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Had for about 3 months before the screen started acting up, and not displaying correctly, then the touch screen wasn’t working for about 2 weeks then all of a sudden it worked again. Emailed them 3 times about the issues and have not heard anything. Very disappointed, don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Layser

customer_reviews.title: bad product
customer_reviews.text: the unit does not hold a charge. I am not sure if is a bad design by microsoft or is the supplier sent me a bad one. I sent message to supplier but they never responded.
customer_reviews.author: tarpon

product_meta.title: Microsoft Surface Go (Intel Pentium Gold, 4GB RAM, 64GB)
product_meta.description: Style:Device Only| Size:4GB / 64GB| Configuration:Surface GoNew 10” Surface Go is perfect for all your daily tasks, giving you laptop performance with tablet portability, all-day battery life, a stunning touchscreen, and the Windows you know. Starting at just 1.15 lbs., new 10” Surface Go is our smallest, lightest Surface yet. It fits easily in your bag and gives you laptop performance with tablet portability. Count on new Surface Go to run Office and other day-to-day software and apps, with a powerful Intel Pentium Gold Processor and up to 9 hours of battery life. Sleek and slim, new Surface Go is designed with a stunning 10” PixelSense Display with touchscreen that's perfect for browsing, working, and binge watching. Surface Go runs the latest Windows laptop operating system and Office 365, and comes with Windows 10 in S mode, to do the things you want with performance that lasts.
feature_bullets: High res 10 inch PixelSense Display designed to be viewed, touched, and written on
Lightest Surface yet, starting at just 1.15 pounds. Aspect ratio: 3:2
All day battery life, with up to 9 hours of unplugged power. LTE Advanced Up to 8.5 hours of battery life for local video playback
Comes with Windows 10 in S mode, to do the things you want with performance that lasts, including Microsoft verified security, Windows Defender, parental controls, and world class support
Includes multi tasking USB C, fast charging Surface Connect, and headphone jack

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,079 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
